title: Citizens Hub
progressBarStep2NotDone: Documents have not yet been received
progressBarStep3NotDone: Application is not yet in review
progressBarStep4NotDone: Grant has not yet been issued
applicationReceivedParagraph:
A caseworker will review your application after we’ve received and checked your documents.

To avoid any delays in reviewing your application, you must send us the original will and any other documents we’ve requested.

We’ll email you when we receive your documents. There might be a delay of up to 2 weeks from us receiving your documents and sending the email.

You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks. It can take longer if you need to provide additional information. We’ll email you if we need more information.
intestacyApplicationReceivedParagraph:
A caseworker will review your application after we’ve received and checked your documents.

To avoid any delays in reviewing your application, you must send us the documents we’ve requested.

We’ll email you when we receive your documents. There might be a delay of up to 2 weeks from us receiving your documents and sending the email.

You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks. It can take longer if you need to provide additional information. We’ll email you if we need more information.
noDocsRequiredAppReceivedParagraph:
A caseworker will review your application.

You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks. It can take longer if you need to provide additional information. We’ll email you if we need more information.
documentsReceivedParagraph: A caseworker will review your application. You don’t need to do anything else, we’ll email you if we need more information.
applicationReviewParagraph: You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks of submitting your application. It can take longer if you need to provide additional information. We’ll email you if we need more information.
caseStoppedHeading: We need more information to progress your application
caseStoppedParagraph:
We have sent you an email with more details. If you have already responded and provided the requested information, you can ignore this message – your application is now being reviewed.

You'll usually get the grant within 12 weeks of when we receive your application. It may take longer as you needed to provide additional information.
caseStoppedParagraph1: We have reviewed your application for probate. You need to provide some additional information before your application can progress.
caseStoppedParagraph2: A caseworker has sent you an email with the information they need.
caseStoppedParagraph3: Read the caseworker’s reasons for stopping the application and provide the information they’ve asked for.
caseStoppedParagraph4: If the caseworker has asked for documents, you will be able to upload them when you respond.
caseStoppedParagraph5: We will let you know once we have reviewed your response.
caseStoppedParagraph6: You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks of when you submitted your application. It can take longer as you have to provide additional information.
informationProvidedHeading: You have responded to the request
informationProvidedParagraph1: A caseworker will now review your response. You will get an email with an update on your application by {date}.
informationProvidedParagraph2: You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks of when you submitted your application. It can take longer as you had to provide additional information.
partialInformationParagraph2: As you’ve told us you could not upload some or all of your documents, we cannot progress your application until we’ve received them.
partialInformationProvidedHeading: What you need to do next
partialInformationParagraph3: We have sent you an email with details on how to send your documents.
partialInformationParagraph4: Reply to the email and attach your documents or send them by post, along with a cover sheet with your 16-digit case reference.
partialInformationParagraph5: A caseworker will then review your response.
partialInformationParagraph6: You’ll usually get the grant within 12 weeks of when you submitted your application. It can take longer as you had to provide additional information.
caseClosedParagraph:
We have not issued your grant.

Check your email for more information.
grantIssuedParagraph1:
You should get the grant within 2 week of it being issued.

If there’s anything wrong with the probate document, return it to the district probate registry listed on the grant.

Helpful Information
grantIssuedParagraph2:
Find out what to do when you receive your grant

Order more copies of your grant using the Search probate records for documents and wills service.

If you ordered copies of your probate document for use outside the UK, also known as ‘sealed and certified’ copies, these will take upto 2 weeks longer to arrive than your UK copy.
sideBarParagraph: Read applying for probate guidance (opens in a new tab)
insertText: Call the Probate Call Centre if you have any questions about your application. They cannot give you any legal advice or process any updates to your application.
callCharges: Find out about call charges (opens in a new window)
